chapter.title: You are responsible for product quality
chapter.p: In case you primary job is management rather than coding, you should know the answer to the "How things are going?" question at any time. You can track the development process using reports from version control systems, bug trackers, and during meetings. Still, monitoring of software quality is missing, and you can only refer to conclusions from your team leaders or architects. Looking at the code cannot help you in this case. Also, collecting information about quality code can be a tedious task. You can use %product% to automate the quality assessment process, and %product_cloud% will let you see the overall picture.

chapter.title: You work for an outsourcing company that resells IT services
chapter.p: Your company may deal with lots of various projects from different fields, which makes it difficult to be expert in all of them. Oftentimes, software products are developed on the customers' side, but quality monitoring is still part of your work. Using %product_cloud% as an aggregator of %product% reports will definitely help you in this case.

chapter.title: Your company relies on open source
chapter.p: Today's software products often resort to open source libraries to perform specific tasks. This approach saves companies time and money. Unfortunately, nobody could assure you that their code is free of bugs, and their licenses will meet your needs. Besides that, you cannot control the process of open source development. Using %product% on GitHub, you can monitor quality of open source software used in your project, and the License Audit linter will inspect all licenses. But if your project uses tens or hundreds of free libraries, this becomes a challenging task. Using %product_cloud% allows you to aggregate tons of reports under a single roof.

chapter.title: Your company purchases software from third-party vendors
chapter.p: In case your company buys software from the outside, you still need to make sure that its quality meets your needs. Using %product% will give you detailed reports generated by tried-and-tested software from JetBrains, and %product_cloud% will aggregate reports from all %product% instances.
